from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from office365.sharepoint.client_context import ClientContext
from office365.runtime.auth.client_credential import ClientCredential
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, to_timestamp

# Initialize Spark session
spark = SparkSession.builder.appName("LatestSharePointFolder").getOrCreate()

# SharePoint connection details
site_url = "https://pinso365.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/DataandPerformance/Employee%20Central%20Data%20Downloads/Monthly?csf=1&web=1&e=L1vHFu"
client_id = "your_client_id"
client_secret = "your_client_secret"

# Authenticate with SharePoint
credentials = ClientCredential(client_id, client_secret)
ctx = ClientContext(site_url).with_credentials(credentials)

# Specify the SharePoint folder path
folder_path = "/sites/your_site/Shared Documents/Your_Folder"

# Get folder information
folder = ctx.web.get_folder_by_server_relative_url(folder_path)
sub_folders = folder.folders
ctx.load(sub_folders)
ctx.execute_query()

# Extract folder information
folder_info = [(f.properties['Name'], f.properties['TimeCreated']) for f in sub_folders]

# Convert to PySpark DataFrame
df = spark.createDataFrame(folder_info, ["FolderName", "CreatedTime"])

# Convert CreatedTime to timestamp and find the latest folder
df = df.withColumn("CreatedTime", to_timestamp(col("CreatedTime")))
latest_folder = df.orderBy(col("CreatedTime").desc()).first()

print(f"The latest folder is: {latest_folder['FolderName']}")
print(f"Created at: {latest_folder['CreatedTime']}")

# Stop the Spark session
spark.stop()
